heading: Who receives the most migrants?
subheading: In 2023, the EU welcomed 4.3 million immigrants, which was a 17.9% decrease from the 5.3 million recorded in 2022. Overall, there were around 10 immigrants for every 1,000 EU residents, with the highest numbers recorded in Malta (76 per 1,000 inhabitants), Cyprus (43) and Luxembourg (40).
textNote: To maintain scale and effectively show the differences between other countries, the high value for Malta has been omitted. Bulgaria, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Finland and Sweden did not include refugees from Ukraine who benefit from temporary protection in their population and migration statistics.
